BeM0MWB1FO4vvi9VGS3rIg.text: The people are great, coffee is delicious and the vibe is amazing. Very spacious  for work and relaxing

mUjgr_i_li2Ps8p8SUnrCw.text: I love to try out new coffee shops.... Undercurrent sure is a great spot!!!  I had a vanilla iced latte-with oat milk-so delicious!!!  It is a beautiful place with plenty of seating inside and out.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

rA50bvNSXAmJn-PmRg4_GA.text: This place is so cute. We got the lavender honey latte with oat milk & brown sugar vanilla cold brew, they both were amazing! Definitely coming back.

82kGQYaMuhK4rBNvzYq1CQ.text: Second time here and came to the conclusion this is my new favorite coffee spot in CLT. Everything is delicious. The 'bacon bomblette' is good with tasty bacon eggs and vegetables! Would definitely order again. Iced latte with brown sugar vanilla syrup is not overly sweet, just plain delicious.  Wishing and hoping they'll soon offer matcha that is unsweetened though :/  Love this spot. Will be back.

WQzb6LKN2e3yFG6MMNBWtQ.text: Coffee was amazing in a hot summer day! Got the cold brew and it was nice and nutty, not too acidic

nfHH4D3bAevidoMDfMPlIw.text: undercurrent coffee is very pleasant on the inside and has amazing coffee. i had a brown sugar vanilla latte and enjoyed every sip of it. one complaint i would have and the reason i took one star off is their lack of milk options. they only have regular milk and oat milk which could make it difficult for some people or diets. maybe consider expanding your milk options? :-)

DRk5Ms3fhExyw6CuuM-u5A.text: An amazing place with a great environment , great coffee too !! The staff was so nice and helpful , Because i had never been there i wanted to try something new and they helped perfectly with that !

OB7_z9f72m278YevFvGdnA.text: It's pricey but still may be my new go-to place in Plaza Midwood.  I really like the atmosphere of this place. Most coffee shops take on the dirty, grungy eclectic vibe which I don't mind but it's nice to come to a place that is clean, modern and has great coffee.  The pour-over I got was fantastic although it was $5. When did coffee get so darn expensive?

i3fIAhn2kNtDtSU7ha71nQ.text: My experience at Undercurrent was fantastic.  I had a killer Ethiopian via pour over.  I also tried the Avocado Toast and added the poached egg on top.   It was delicious as well.    The space is primo for doing some work in or you can grab coffee to-go. I live in NoDa, so I'm just a stones throw away.  Can't wait to get back again soon.

09R_qbEYPLpd5e2-_SADaQ.text: Delightfully amazing describes the Brown Sugar Vanilla oat milk latte I casually sipped on while studying for an exam!! The milk was steamed perfectly, they didn't overload the latte with syrup and they finished it with a beautiful design at the end. If you're looking to stay, sitting is somewhat limited but if you go during non-peak hours you should be fine. Facility is super clean, even the bathrooms! Baristas are friendly and efficient. This place even offers educational classes to the community and those looking to grow careers in the coffee world. It's in the heart of a very communal neighborhood in Charlotte called Commonwealth.

RrextsSndwDa0BhK0WHyxA.text: It's a place that serves coffee. Good coffee, or the BEST coffee? There are plenty of "best" coffees: Strava Craft Coffee, Illy, and hundreds of other illusive brands for $$$. My best is Swiss coffee. The preparation of the coffee? Now we get into "coffee snobbery". Drip, pour, press....blah blah blah. I know good coffee. So that isn't the point. When I go to a coffeehouse I intend to sit for a while and have ... many... cups of coffee, and good conversation. The fact that you can't get a good drip coffee after 1pm, instead of having to go through all the machinery and mechanics of "the trendy pour" makes my desire to sit, have some intelligent discourse, over many cups of coffee...feel like a wet bed. The atmosphere here is cold, no "professional" art on the walls, and too many windows (where there should be art - and enclosed to make a more cozy atmosphere. What happened to the...idea...of a coffee house? Apparently the owners need to research the history of coffee houses. And they close at 7pm!? Good grief, coffee drinkers love hanging out in coffee houses until midnight! This place has no vision and no concept for a good coffee house. And the tipping crap needs to stop (for an underserving gesture) ....everywhere. Unless you want to come to my table, take my order, and bring it to me.

UaMzq0ZxdkTJ3-ZLDvjzuw.text: I've been waiting for Undercurrent to open for a while, and it was worth the wait! Coffee here is served as it should be. If you're used to drinking burnt, too hot coffee from that Chain Which will Remain Nameless, then Undercurrent's approach may take some getting used to. They serve coffee at a ready to drink temperature that preserves the nuanced flavors of the high quality beans that they use, and they don't scorch their milk when making lattes. They have rigorously trained their employees to meet a standard of quality and consistency that is really hard to find. I was able to take a sip of the pour over that I ordered without immediately burning my mouth, and the flavors were layered and divine. Are you used to having things your way? A creature of habit? Perhaps just *try* something different and be open to the new experience. Depending on what you order, you should expect to wait longer than you would at that Chain Which will Remain Nameless, but again, it's worth it! This is not a "turn and burn" business model. Praise be! Relax, enjoy the beautiful interior, and let the masters do their work.

yidFa9NviiBuOOJXBAukaw.text: Great coffee place, probably the best around. Very nice and cozy atmosphere. Coffee taste really good. Love this place!

m_zFYvreinh9T_n6OjZPvQ.text: Well worth the wait; I'm so excited about this place! Fresh, bright atmosphere, and plenty of workspace as well as comfy seating. If you're looking to have coffee the way it's meant to be served (not a burnt Starbucks cappuccino), come support this local business. Great people and great coffee. :)

WOxjnMTQV3oUWRrLHqnToA.text: Really good coffee and espresso. The neighborhood needed a great local coffee shop like Undercurrent.

OxpQO2CE5FzuJwQ2RfenKw.text: My favorite new study spot! Lots of cozy chairs to read in and a very friendly and warm staff. The owners are so kind and always around to banter and make sure you're having the best experience! Can rarely go to a coffee shop these days to study without constant interruptions from other customers talking and this place has the best relaxed vibe! Highly recommend

QHdQ5AH0cWpOH-f4TZOW8Q.text: Favorite coffee shop in Charlotte! The atmosphere is beautiful and welcoming. Great coffee and Matcha tea (go with the oat milk!). The avocado toast with egg is a must order, looks just as delicious as it tastes. The owners are kind and their passion for coffee and the community shines. Next time you are looking for a good cup of coffee, breakfast, or a spot to relax or work, I highly recommend Undercurrent Coffee.

bPrEvpsWwIklE-1IH2qmBg.text: A great spot for a well crafted coffee with baristas and an owner that are extremely knowledgeable in the craft. Solid atmosphere, design and overall welcoming crowd. Highly suggest!

TGHkjJYXFvnXp_CN2u38bw.text: Undercurrent is the perfect spot to sit down and read, do homework/work, or have a coffee date. The environment, food, and especially the coffee is fantastic. Sophistication radiates from every part of this coffee shop. From the presentation of the food and coffee, to the decor it's warm and friendly. To sum it all up, it's the place you want to be at.

oX3r7aSBONoTQB6_uuYnvg.text: My husband calls this place granola, I call it amazing and delicious! Coffees are always tasty, I love their cold brew in the summer. The pastries are on point. Must stop by if you love good coffee!

rYhYbxNL-_Mr4rE80SJgjQ.text: Opening day was a crazy party of supporters and curious passers by and it was fun to see the staff do such a great job and handling all the guests, the TV crew and still keep the orders coming in a timely fashion. Super impressed! On a future more low key day I look forward to hanging out for a while to soak in the sunshine from the awesome front windows and maybe try to get some work done between sips of espresso.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

lZaG_sWVZY4YSyu-Gw_EoA.text: Been waiting for this place to open!  Finally got to go today, unfortunately only a few minutes before closing (closes at 5 on a Saturday).  12oz Latte with Breve ended over 6 dollars, which seems high by over a dollar. It was good. The interior was nice, plenty of seating, and very clean.

4KcWN9GB_BDcyUFbVCrWyA.text: Love the shop, clean, modern but cozy at the same time. I like their minimalistic approach to menu and atmosphere. Coffee tastes pretty good, wish they have almond milk tho!

c_-kQDfvNsIV-zZjWD0fSg.text: What a great staff!  Friendly and helpful. I had never had a positive espresso experience. They walked me through it. They really know their stuff! Definitely recommend!

eBCiAbgHT8u_CJv7635T3w.text: Best coffee shop I've ever been to, in terms of drink quality, staff friendliness, and overall feel of the space.

q4LABqaayzUCLEAJnXf3jg.text: In a nutshell: just another mediocre, overpriced Charlotte coffee shop whose patrons are trying too hard to be edgy. A large black coffee is $3.85. That seems  pretty extreme to me for plain black coffee. Coffee tasted bitter. And I'm going to borrow this line from another reviewer: "...the counter person wasn't mean, but that was the extent of the customer service."

SbxEhhUqbji3GHWKJj19Zg.text: So happy this coffee shop opened in Plaza Midwood.  Coffee is great and food is really good too!  Also has very nice atmosphere.

3Du6RE64lpwXzxauvHUk6w.text: 2nd time stopping by and have to say it's pretty good. I've tried the two iced lattes: vanilla and mocha. The espresso is smooth not acidic which is good. Not sure how strong the espresso is. The overall experience inside is real nice, plenty of seating for roughy 40 people. Parking might be an issue, with only a few parking spots but this is plaza midwood. Lattes might be a little expensive for the size. Maybe have 16oz or 20oz. Overall I'll keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

-TGQJcmhsNVUWSYJTE3D9w.text: WOW! If I could give more than five stars I would in a heartbeat. What a perfect coffeeshop. The design is absolutely stunning; open, stylish, clean - I could work on my laptop in this shop all day.  The coffee is flawless. Espresso pulled to perfection, milk steamed just right. A simple menu of classic, quality selections.  Whether or not you're a coffee connoisseur, you'll surely recognize and appreciate the incredible product that Undercurrent delivers.  The owner is so friendly and personable, the staff is helpful, kind, knowledgeable, and efficient. And talented! Wow!  I wouldn't change a thing about my experience. It was a delight in every way. Undercurrent is a GEM in Plaza Midwood and will surely become an instant staple of the Charlotte coffee community.

-cI1jp2V2_LK2hJYMjUFCg.text: The coffee was ok in my opinion. However, their avocado toast with egg was amazing. The seasoning went well with the food.

MRsXcgL4Cc2vuwFmwFyW0Q.text: We visited this coffee house in Midwood we really enjoyed the experience the staff was great.

5FaP6jb9mrb1iuTkOyQVNg.text: They are trying to hard.  They have a simple menu to order from with some complex names .The place is extremely nice  alone with the staff ,but the coffee is nasty . I been here twice already thinking that maybe the first cappuccino I order on my first try was bad. However; after coming again with a friend bragging to him explaining him how nice the place looked when he tasted the coffee he hated it.

gMvrsnUZJ-9TMOQw9kgjwg.text: This is my Friday morning coffee visit.  1. Interior is beautiful,  very clean lined,  almost industrial feel. 2. I got a vanilla latte that was good, portion size not so good for the price.  3. I also got a blueberry chia pudding that I ended up throwing away. Flavor was bland with little brown mint leaves on top, also portion size if it was any good small. 4. 2 stars for interior and friendly baristas. Will probably not return, to many coffee shops around much better.

u7oSfA4AAnWMlLAk-22--Q.text: I was really hoping to love Undercurrent as the coffee scene in Charlotte is extremely lacking. Unfortunately, undercurrent is super expensive and not worth the price. We bought two cold-brews for $4.25 and received two small half filled cups. We even asked for no room. It tasted fine but it sucks when you feel like you paid their electric bill.   Good ambience and the staff was nice but a bit inexperienced.

HLyvi1v0WwUmMdERMuPgkA.text: So excited to have these folks in the neighborhood! The beverage and food options are fantastic (you are missing out if you don't try the grits!), the space is beautiful and the staff is wonderful. Looking forward to making this my go-to coffee & breakfast spot!

CzHWFHPsUqOcwBcxRCofZA.text: Best tea in the town with great service. It's was mind blowing. Than you and see u soon

24KusJYNiu8snbCNgwGuWA.text: My wife and I decided to try this new coffee spot in Plaza Midwood. This place is awesome, such a cool atmosphere and friendly staff. Their iced cold brew was great and my wife ordered the iced lavender latte. I would definitely return to this place again!

vzh_gv8mHEHca_JB3KefDA.text: Loving Undercurrent Coffee! I drive by EVERY DAY but haven't stopped until now and I'm so happy I did! Their outdoor seating is just darling and the staff is wonderful! The menu is simple and straightforward which is not the case with the majority of coffee shops. The exterior has a homey feel and interior is bright, light and cozy! Absolutely obsessed, I will definitely be back!

9dbXVekLuS4eRW--D1uqjg.text: I tried this place for the first time today and I will definitely be back. Staff was so friendly and informative and the overall all vibe was relaxed and chilled. I highly recommend stopping by for a coffee, tea or their brunchy food menu

txP5Zx4vm-FxLeCMsERfYA.text: Great addition to the Plaza Midwood neighborhood! Went on the first Saturday it opened, and as expected, it was packed.  This place got a lot of hype, and I have to admit that it did live up to the expectations.    After we got through the line, I ordered a matcha latte with almond milk (they also have oat milk!), the avocado toast with a poached egg, and a triangle shaped oat-like dessert pastry (I don't remember the name of it, but it was sooo delicious!). The matcha latte was as expected, and the avo toast was really good!  It is served on a nice thick slice of bread, with fresh avocado, and spices.  The egg was absolutely cooked to perfection!  I personally hate when I order a poached egg with a yolk nearly all the way cooked, and this was definitely not that. Would recommend, but the only downside is that it is a bit pricey, but find me a specialty coffee shop that isn't...

LSt4P9DJ5HrOHo74IBPbNQ.text: Oh my gosh, I used to live in PM and walk past Undercurrent Coffee like, everyday, and I always was like "BUT WILL THEY EVER OPEN." I heard it was a bit of a struggle with permits, etc and I felt so bad!  Great little addition to what fills a definite void in the Plaza. Great space, great light, comfy seating, good service.  They don't offer unsweetened matcha which was disappointing. Ended up with an iced coffee and almond milk. J had an iced vanilla latte.  The glassware was nice for dining in, but kind of small.  Price was in line of other shops in town. Not Just, Hex, Trade & Lore, etc. about $12 all-in for two drinks.

vugKGv4argxkjJriKtu9BA.text: I have been here three times now since I've moved to Charlotte and I must say they make a good clean latte and have completely sold me on OAT milk. The oat milk definitely covers the bitter taste of coffee/espresso. They have a cozy layout for spending a morning. Definitely my favorite spot so far!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

edEdOw7Z6vvJU1QhUzcTUg.text: This is by far the best coffee shop in Plaza Midwood! I am a coffee snob and they never disappoint. Only possible con I can think of is they don't offer any decaf options but they will soon! I usually go for a vanilla latte with oat milk. Their baristas are very friendly and precise. Great place to study or grab a coffee with friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Espresso machine

EGQjdzsJ3vqi3aOTx89wnA.text: Love this coffee shop:) cute, clean atmosphere. Awesome service and most importantly great coffee and variety! Love the coffee, lattes, and the yummy avocado toast!

715HLFkvLHMAn68LpCIcLA.text: Great coffee. Great people. Great atmosphere. Great location. This place is the ideal coffee shop. Been here several times and I am thoroughly impressed with every visit. The coffee is top notch. I'm not a total coffee snob but my friends that are love this place. The coffee is delicious and they put alot of pride into their product. Dogs are more than welcome to hangout outside as well which is always cool to see. Keep it up undercurrent!

T_sSo5jGKG52SNh2-yk4qw.text: Absolutely AMAZING! The employees were so helpful and just brought so much joy! I would definitely try the strawberry matcha and the blueberry chia pudding! Definitely coming back before I move!

mf17-83w2ypsJ8ZRkj69Hw.text: Friendly staff, good coffee, and healthy bites. Family and I came here for our morning breakfast on a visit to Charlotte. The cold brew and brown sugar vanilla latte were great. We also enjoyed the breakfast grits, avocado toast, chevre & jam toast and banana & peanut butter toast very much!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grits, peanut butter banana toast, chèvre &amp; jam toast, avocado toast
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cold brew coffee
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado toast &amp; peanut butter banana toast

s0M6T0kkB0BsHrgjx0i41w.text: One of my favorite cafes in charlotte. The place is spacious and well decorated, feeling cozy and comfy with my breakfast!! I got winter signature drink:candied ginger latte, great mix with the syrup and the coffee! My friend got matcha latte and banana cake! The latte art is pretty as well. BTW, DO NOT miss their avotoast!!! Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

Nky_wPzkCqzXoCp0C9GquA.text: Welcoming staff. Drinks are not good. I tried two of their homemade soda drinks and both are not delicious.

pWmYuwF51PXjM61_MpfZHA.text: wanted: basic b*!ch seeking extremely 'gram worthy coffee shop with on point lighting, soothing aesthetic, colorful food and pretty drinks.  undercurrent coffee: check, check, check and check!   coffee: lots of options for coffee and non-coffee drinkers. i'm not huge on coffee but still found great options, ESPECIALLY that iced chai.  food: i think what i enjoy about the menu is that they have an awesome balance of savory and sweet foods for breakfast/brunch. the avocado toast is actually quite filling and they don't skimp on the avocado. had it twice and probably will 3, 4, you get it.  in terms of sweet i've tried the blueberry chia pudding and the golden milk yogurt. again filling, pretty to look at and yummy without being sickeningly sweet. all the mistakes you made in your diet that week are forgiven when you've had these, i promise! also sampled their banana bread which was freshly baked and perfect for two to split.  environment: this is somewhere where you can't blame someone for taking a picture of their food (you're doing it too)! the decor is so perfect for a coffee shop. muted and blues that has an overall calming effect along with a very friendly staff. you notice all these little details that lets you know the owners really care about the space. it is slightly smaller but waiting for a table to open up hasn't taken me more than a few minutes. plus it's in the heart of plaza so you're in a great location to do a little day exploring of the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. avocado toast, golden milk yogurt
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. blueberry chia pudding, avocado toast and one of the best iced chai lattes i&#39;ve had

npFYh8fs00XKZOSuKDyaxA.text: Undercurrent is currently my favorite coffee shop in town. The vibe inside is awesome with a lot of natural lighting and seating options for groups or remote workers with laptops. They have great avocado toast and they have water with cups out to help yourself. I have gotten several espresso drinks which were all great and service was friendly. It can just seem to get backed up sometimes /take a little long on the drinks. High quality and taste worth the price. These aren't American/Starbucks sizes a little smaller like high quality coffee shops out West.

bEISSfs6gajExXY_6ofHLg.text: I purchased a "large" ice coffee and some sort of grit meal.  No complaints everything tasted pretty good .    I signed my bill and was thinking it was high but didn't think too much of it. I then got my "large" ice coffee and it was a small medium at best. I then drank it pretty fast and wanted a top off and she made me pay again.  That's when I realized that the ice coffee was $4.60.  I paid $9.20 cents for no more than 12OZ of coffee!  That has to be at least a 3000% margin!! That is completely insane and leaves a horrible taste in my mouth even though the coffee is pretty good.   Not going back.

8xbKks1_31ZAvxdrf-rGhw.text: A warm welcome to coffee lovers alike but I have to say there were a few lack luster very important qualities that make a coffee house, well, a coffee house (literally). This shop is out of a house, its quaint, its bright, its modern with nooks in several places inside for one to work, read or socialize. It also has a nice front sitting area to enjoy alfresco. Everyone I encountered was "friendly enough". I ordered the pour over which I love in general because you truly get to enjoy and savor your coffee. I found the brew to be very weak and when I used the alternative oak milk provided aside from cream which I can't do, I found that it was even more distant to the taste of coffee. My friend ordered the cold brew and asked for a shot of espresso. I took a sip just to see, and I probably would go back and try an espresso style drink next time, with an extra shot. I wish they had also provided almond milk aside from cream and oat milk, but perhaps it wasn't set up that day (?). I was pressed to try the avocado toast since its extremely highlighted when I had read up on them. Initially I was impressed because it looked beautiful, the micro amaranth is so pretty and such a great color contrast to the avocado. I asked for the egg to be on top which was cooked perfectly. The toast itself was very tasty, as were the spiced seeds, however, there was this faint taste of I am thinking cumin??? My initial bite, I was intrigued but after my third I didn't have a desire to finish it, it just had this strange taste. I left hungry but not hungry enough to try something else. I want to give it another shot because I really enjoy a nice coffee shop, update to follow.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado toast
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

BUHPEbuLFru266yt2lbLlg.text: Very nice atmosphere! This was my first time going and the cashier was very helpful on giving me recommendations. I ordered their grit bowl and drip coffee. Both were excellent, the grit bowl had a lot of flavor, very different from your traditional grits. If you like trying new things, definitely give it a tr

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

50bLT1MpfE79GG52fLlVwQ.text: As others have said, the prices are high for what you get. I was excited for this place but my experience was lackluster. The barista who took my order wasn't mean but that's about the extent of the customer service I received. I love when I can order a drink "for here" and receive it in a mug, but I don't like when it's lukewarm. The espresso was tasty, but nothing extraordinary to justify the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Latte

HBev0S2hCjg-Cdad1DmaRA.text: baristas are all uber friendly & the large windows make great for natural light. i literally loooove coming here to work & enjoy a nice cup of coffee or matcha. plenty of space for a casual cup or a collab meeting or some private work.

u0du8tssB_XjLfI-nwZynA.text: Real expensive for a house turned coffee shop. Also the food takes a year and a half to get done. I got the grits bowl and it was pretty good! Also, huge nest outside by the sitting area.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

5uD7NhkgZdGkLpPlAavztg.text: My husband and I always try out new coffee places as that is our weekend thing. Excited to try out undercurrent but slightly disappointed when the largest sized coffee they have was no bigger than an actual sized small coffee. Paying $5 for something so small isn't quite what I was expecting. Other than the size, the coffee and atmosphere is nice. Not sure we will be back but it was worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

Ldgh0zXh5YaNXWeG0x27sA.text: Waited 2 years for this spot to open. The inside looks beautiful. TV crew was there as well as the owner. Very nice gentleman.  I ordered a grit bowl and a cappuccino. I asked for milk alternatives. They only offer oat milk. I wanted a scrambled egg, they couldn't offer that. And the worst part is my cappuccino was LUKE WARM!  The espresso has a good flavor.  It is smaller than I expected on the inside. No patio either.  Apple Pay wasn't working which is highly expected for a first day.  So I do expect great things from this coffee shop such as a variety of milk alternatives and hot espresso.  Good luck guys!

Ey8vPOq5QaurIWJPxmQuhQ.text: While my husband was getting his haircut at Charlotte Barber and Beard (seriously those guys do great work!) I wanted somewhere to go to wait. I kept seeing this place pop up on my social media and the outside is so cute and inviting that o decided to check it out!   Right of way the place has a modern but cozy feel. Very tastefully decorated! The have plush chairs and two seater couches for people. There is also more room in the back. The place is all windows (at least up front) which allows for natural light!   The lady at the counter was really sweet. I told her it was my first time and she explained the menu to me. What I really enjoyed was that there weren't a million different coffee options. That always overwhelms me and stresses me out at other places. It was a simple and clean menu. There were some interesting tea options, but I decided to go for the iced latte.  Side note: have you ever looked at a coffee picture and say "I want that" and whenever you order you can never seem to get it..well that DIDN'T happen here! I got what I saw in a picture, it looked the same, and it was so delicious!!! Although I thought I ordered the brown sugar latte and they gave me a vanilla one. It doesn't matter though because it was so good.   The coffee is on the expensive side (just my opinion). My iced latte was a little over $5. Again very delicious, but definitely not an everyday stop. All in all this coffee shop should be checked out!

GJcMbePlCoe6wqZjjLCnKQ.text: Two words: yum & cool.  The 7 Spice Mocha is muy muy delicioso & the vibe is cool.  Lots of black turtlenecks.  Thank God I was wearing one myself.  Cozy spot for solo work or a meetup.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

HPTipC5fJZgEZ2LA1ZXxJQ.text: Really delicious coffee and relaxing environment.   I got an iced latte w oat milk- really quality coffee with a very smooth taste. Love that they have vegan milk options!   I tried the grit bowl too- so tasty! It's not huge but it's enough to be full without being overstuffed. The grits are seriously the BEST IVE EVER HAD. Not greasy, plenty of flavor. Definitely pay to add an egg on top. The mushrooms and goat cheese topping that come standard are delicious   They have a lovely indoor space- good for doing work or relaxing and chatting. They also have a few tables outside. Make sure you check inside for your order- they won't track you down to give your food or coffee

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grit bowl - Add an egg!! Grits are perfect. Iced latte is smooth and delicious

EbVYDVz76_tJY4ibbcxMUQ.text: Their white chocolate pistachio orange latte is the bomb. I literally drive across town for it. I will be sad when it rotates off the spring menu, but I'm sure they will replace it with something equally awesome. Their coffee, ambiance and service are great. Bonus - they've got oat milk.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Who&#39;re chocolate pistachio orange latte with oat milk

-cqID6av64oLlEmpvSX9CQ.text: Love this place - great coffee, good environment, and good food. They do well with presentation of their food, but I wasn't impressed with the avocado toast. The peanut/granola topping was super salty and very dry. Overall I love this place, but probably will stick to the grit bowl.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado toast

0oLiLPxZMZoDR7XjGkkXsw.text: This coffee spot is such a great fit for the area.  It's very open and airy with sofas, chairs, bar stools and lots of windows for people watching.  It has a very homey and comfortable feel as some people were working, meeting for coffee or just hanging out.  The baristas were super friendly and carried on conversations as they made drinks for their customers.  I ordered the iced mocha with oat milk and the grit bowl with mushrooms, roasted peppers, and onions.  I sat at the bar and enjoyed my iced mocha while the grit bowl was being made.  The grit bowl was really tasty and I loved the fresh mushrooms and other toppings.  They offer mainly a limited breakfast menu, a few salads and of course coffee and tea.  Check them out if you're in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

D0atdKKAac92ioi6Wob53g.text: Cute little coffee place in Plaza Midwood. It's funny when you pass something a million times but never truly notice it until someone invites you to the place. That's what happened with me and Undercurrent Coffee. I've apparently passed this place multiple times and never seen it, and I'm so sad about that.   This coffee shop is great and quiet and even better it's an awesome workspace. After my coffee meeting, I spent some time working in the open space they have available. They offer free wifi and comfy lounge chairs while you're working. On warmer days I would definitely recommend working outside under the shade tree. It's very peaceful and in the day it's not busy.   I would certainly recommend this place for working, meeting friends, or simple coffee + chill.

_mm2EQEU55GLhXAusadpJw.text: I really really like this place. Their coffee is great and I love the atmosphere. The service has always been amazing and my coffee has always been very good.  There food needs to be stepped up a whole notch though. Their baked goods are just really bland and never what I want.

NijL-I6A8GknxMAvjYh6EA.text: I love this place! Their drip coffee is the best and they are so friendly. I sat in the shop basically all day a few weeks back while my car was being serviced and I couldn't go back and wait at my house and they did not seem to mind one bit. It is definitely my favorite coffee shop in the neighborhood, if not in Charlotte!

IlIqb-UeNA6aErcnMcfngA.text: Beautiful, beautiful spot with it's own parking lot in the heart of Plaza. Why did I feel the need to mention that? Maybe it's because of that stupid horrible awful terrible no good very bad parking situation in the rest of the neighborhood. Anyways.   There are tons of seating options all throughout Undercurrent and despite a pretty packed house, we were able to find several options, including snagging a seat with strangers at one of the larger tables. I ordered a latte (my benchmark coffee shop drink) and was offered the option of a single origin espresso. Sure, why not? I also got breakfast there with their grits option. Sounded good enough.  The latte came out in a generous mug with wonderful steamed milk art (per usual these days, but there are still some that stand out). The flavor was EXCELLENT, it really made the coffee sing. Complex and dark. The grits arrived shortly after and they were served in a ceramic bowl. Holy cow. Man, these were awesome savory grits with cremini mushrooms. I've seen enough, the food here is great as well as the coffee.   Wifi is plentiful and there are tons of work stations and outlets, which was perfect as The Lady and I showed up to do some photo editing. I had a great experience at Undercurrent and won't hesitate to come back.   One word of advice/caution: If you're easily affected by cold temperatures, you may want to bring a jacket. The Lady has been there more than I have at this point and she says that the AC has consistently ran on MEGA HIGH mode at all times. So... you've been warned. Winter is coming. For those warm bloods like me, you'll be fine ;)

qX4DPuug-rzrldjz-QPqGQ.text: Undercurrent is rare for a few reasons.   1. Everything is done well. Everything! From the decor, to the product, the playlist in the background, to the layout of the space--the care the owner takes with this business is apparent.   2. Personable, friendly and knowledgeable staff. If you read my reviews, you know that customer service is EVERYTHING to me.   3. Location. It's hard to go wrong with a coffee house in Plaza-Midwood. However, Undercurrent is pleasantly positioned in a space that welcomes people-watching or just a nice vibe for creativity.   I was not overwhelmed by my chai latte--I've had better. But, I appreciate the fact that it was a real chai instead of a concentrated mix.   Can't wait to visit again!

VN9bQ7Z8bftXye_Ix0AH4g.text: My matcha late was beautiful and delicious. It's light and flavorful but not too heavy which I like because matcha latte can be thick. I also ate the avocado toast with an egg. I absolutely looove it. It has a very unique taste and makes me want more. It's a very relaxing place to enjoy coffee and study. The service is excellent as well! This is probably one of my favorite cafes in Charlotte now.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

t5d27PWsi_Yg71pvPMhTDg.text: Vanilla brown sugar latte?!? Yes, please! I watched this coffee house for months and months and months and months and anxiously awaited its opening and it did not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

TQqYiozckkAc0kos-qSlUA.text: Undercurrent coffee is a great spot to come relax and enjoy some good coffee.  The baristas are friendly and the vibe is great.  The decor is really nice and nicely curated. There is a lot of natural light inside which is great. As per the coffee it was really flavorful and tasted great (no bitterness) plus the latte art was cute.  The avocado toast was also really fresh and tasty (the only reason why I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I felt it was a little pricy for the size $7). All in all it was a great experience and I would definitely recommend coming here for a nice relaxing coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Latte + avocado toast $12
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice sitting outside

HDMctiy00d6-PbbzERmCSA.text: Everything you want from a coffee shop. The menu is filled with vegan options, they have a small selection of pastries, and a classic selection of coffee and espresso. I had the iced latte with oat milk and vanilla, highly recommend. Not many places carry oat milk so I was pleasantly surprised. I sprung for the grits bowl and it was fantastic. My boyfriend got the avocado toast which was also very good. Atmosphere is relaxing with a modern aesthetic. Worth a stop by - there's a quaint shop next door with local jewelry that's also worth checking out afterward.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avo toast with egg
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grits bowl. Cooked perfectly and not too heavy!

ajmVN-3aLXVnA2zXMpo3Mw.text: This coffee shop is a welcome addition to the Plaza Midwood coffee scene. The owners are lovely people with an amazing story of triumph and determination.  The variety of coffee from drip coffee, pour overs, and lattes embody a delectable twist on your average cup of joe.  The pour overs are amazing and the flavor profiles and notes of the coffee are amazing and leave you with dreaming of a second serving.  And can I say I love that they have Oatly oat milk.  I've not tried it yet, but the Golden Milk and Matcha latte seem to be popular among patrons each time I've gone. They are on my list to try!  The food menu is expertly crafted and prepared and offers something for everyone.  My favorites so far are the sour cream coffee cake, scones, avocado toast with the poached egg.   The ambiance lends to a comforting but chic environment to plug-in to work, meet a few folks over coffee, or just connect with locals.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee Cake with a Vanilla Brown Sugar Latte made with Oatly milk!

jWQcZzgBjMKF0uVRo3mMKA.text: Love this coffee shop in plaza! Reminds me of those you'll find in Portland or west coast. It's very modern, open and light. Love the wooden tables and open seating areas. They do oat milk , which is my favorite. I tried the gritz bowl (their signature) and it was delicious! Not overly heavy and buttery where you feel sick after. The crimini mushrooms are a must add, and add the egg! They also source food locally which is important to me. If I lived closer I'd come here to work often. The baristas are friendly and the larger bathroom has furniture that can be used as a chasing table too, which makes bringing a baby easier. Great spot and delicious coffee!

7x5-asMkCNbSncKs-UGHVg.text: anyone who would give this coffee shop less than 5 stars is LYING. hands down the best coffee and tea beverages i've had in the charlotte area, possibly ever. Order the Matcha Latte (if you like green tea products) and you WONT be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

cwuqDNrLYhleuLsBdA5SQg.text: Super cool new coffee shop in Plaza Midwood! I walked in a little before 9am on a Saturday and the place was already packed. Barely any wait for coffee, so the staff moves pretty quick.  I ended up with the Pure Intentions Cold Brew on tap. So good! They have half and half and almond milk on the side, and whole milk behind the bar.  I guess Almond Milk is all the rage now, but I'm not into it.  The first time I went, I got a good cold brew.  The second time, I got a latte.  I do love that they have some simple syrup on the side bar rather than a bunch of different sugar options.  I also ordered the Avocado Toast with an egg on top, and it literally looked like a work of art. Sliced avocado, too, not guacamole!  The ambiance is very welcoming.  There are a number of modern chairs/couches and some community tables where you can work or meet someone for coffee.  The place is much bigger than it looks, so don't be scared to go to the back!  Overall, I'm really happy with the new addition to the Plaza Midwood area. The place is inviting and you will not hesitate to just sit for a few minutes and enjoy your coffee with some latte art on the top.  If your'e looking to just run in, grab a quick cup and bolt out without making conversation with the staff, I would say this place isn't for you.

RBjwT7Imr1gF9yMsEIh5kg.text: Coffee is good, something tasty to snack on. But why no orange juice? Not even in a box, not speaking about fresh-squeezed one here...

C1XpBX9Zbd9EDBo_b-TOPw.text: One of my favorite coffee shops. It's has a nice modern and cozy environment that you could spend hours working on writing blogs and code.   There is also educational opportunities to see the highly scientific / intricate process in making a perfect cup of coffee that's worthwhile in checking out.  I highly recommend checking this place out before 3pm for some brunch. The seasonal drinks are my favorite thus far.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avacodo Toast
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

4gHEuSUNVC1Ytml1UFCp4w.text: What a cool place with potential but... falling just short of a 5 star only for the poor set-up of the place as soon as you walk in you walk straight into the line waiting for orders and tables stacked right in the front area add to the congestion and claustrophobic feel of the restaurant, once you order and get to the back it opens up quite a bit. We made our order and apparently they yell your name but in our case with people filling the front and and people talking in the back we never heard them call us, so our food just sat there and got away from just cooked temp. We both ordered the avocado Toast and it was very good and in the world of restaurants not being able to cook eggs properly the poached eggs were perfect! and the toast was just plain awesome. Coffee was okay and the coffee prep area is another place that is poorly designed, to make your coffee with all of the other traffic near the front and people waiting for their food to be called (So apparently they don't miss out and end up with food cold also wait in the front area, adding to the already congested front area.) it is a constant, excuse me, pardon me, sorry, excuse me, pardon me. They do have free WiFi. We will try it again and a different coffee instead of their brewed see if it is a better quality for us. The crowd at the front was a pain but not enough to take away from the cool vibe of this place, I think maybe just some moving around of things could make this much more pleasant and put Menus outside in a box so people can make up their mind before the counter and move coffee prep further back in the room. This may take care of the congestion and if your people notice food still sitting there mins later have them call it out again. I know you are looking at this wondering why still 4 stars, it is because cool Vibe, Good food, Service was adequate,  we may have caught it during their busy time, the noise level was too loud for us to hear them call our names for our food. Benefit of the doubt. We will return a couple more times.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado toast
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

fmXA3riFSSd_00VYUBZsKg.text: Very cute coffee bar located in the heart of Plaza Midwood. I'm a NODA resident and typically go to my local coffee spot however my fiance told me about UC from a "Next Door" post.   Being my first time, I must have come around rush hour lol because it was pretty packed. I ended up sitting at the bar for maybe an hour until after noon which it started to slow down. Not the best place to take a business call but outside on the patio was much better. Being a French press coffee drinker the the medium roast was a bit weak and they were out of dark roast by noon which was weird. For the life of me, I couldn't connect to their wireless and another guy sitting next to me said the same. I verified the password twice so maybe it was an operator problem lol.  Overall, it was a good experience and I'll definitely be back. Such a nice open and well lite space. I'll probably come before or after noon to avoid the rush but definitely check out UC, very cool spot.

ramcyvbJyI9gHXDOxq38BQ.text: So there are many things to love here - drinks are incredible (we get americanos or almond/oat milk lattes), toasts are good and the pastry we got was nice.   The issue is the seating and people camping out there for HOURS. Its very hard to find a spot and the drinks take a while so even just waiting for your drink is awkward. We often sit outside which is a good option. They may need even more seating there too.

nfVBdTtx_94S4gv9xJZ9Xg.text: I am a big fan of Onyx coffee and was so happy to see a Charlotte coffee shop serving this brand. This is a very cool spot that has great drinks and a cute little outdoor patio that you can sit at with your dogs to enjoy your drink. The inside has a great vibe as well, and would be an ideal spot to get work done by yourself or have a visit with friends. Definitely worth a stop in if you're a coffee lover in Plaza Midwood!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pour overs

AdWBx1GEFD_lKkBJfSxIHw.text: The most unique drinks, delicious & healthy food, and relaxed atmosphere! Absolutely my favorite coffee shop in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Espresso Soda

4rvmIMD3yEW5EpeFkjy9yA.text: I visited the shop on a Saturday and it was very busy.   Parking:  There is a very small area in the back of the shop for customers. You will likely find parking as I did, on the street.  This particular Saturday I was o my able to find a seat after I ordered and  another customer happened to be leaving.   Undercurrent sells and uses coffee from Onyx Coffee out of Arkansas.  I ordered and enjoyed the candied ginger cappuccino.   The staff was extremely nice and if I should visit Charlotte again I will definitely stop in again.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Candied Ginger cappuccino
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

v4TSI8thcrUWFSdr44y_7A.text: This place is so cute. I got an iced lavender latte to go and it was excellent. Definitely coming back

CTsTBRR6iUmpSInuu3dOKA.text: The environment here is warm and cozy. It's a quaint little spot in the heart of Plaza Midwood. The staff is helpful and good with suggestions. There are quite a few spots to sit and a lot of people congregate outside.   I had the Golden Milk, which was ok. I have had more flavorful ones at other places, but it wasn't terrible. I think next time I will most definitely try something different. They have some awesome sounding seasonal drinks that I'm up for trying.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Golden milk
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

Fjy76WEYUkLmNO9lWapuBQ.text: Such a cute little coffee house. Service is friendly and ready to explain anything to you . Bar, lounge, and table seating available throughout, a very clean place.  The coffee is amazing and served on a lovely oblong plate with a mini carafe for more coffee when you need it .  All of the baked fresh daily in house. I highly recommend the vegan sweet potato muffin .

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drip Coffee and a vegan sweet potato muffin. This sweet potato muffin is the loveliest thing not made with an egg

C_rhnoMMqEH0njwu2y0Khg.text: Finally got to give this place a try! Long overdue as I'm in the neighborhood now and all.  Undercurrent you are cool and have good vibes!  Tucked away in Plaza Midwood, in the poppin spot at the end of commonwealth near Legion brewery & Common market. They have one only parking lot, in the back. It has  5 spots plus 1 handicap and 1 other reg spot. Total of 7 spots! So might have to find some street parking, but the walk ain't bad and it's free.   Once you walk up, you notice the outside seating area which is nice. Then you walk in to find more cozy nooks. Well mostly chairs and couches. But also some bar seating, table seating, and benches. It seems to be a good place to study or meet up with friends for coffee. Anything goes! Good vibes inside.   Menu wise. I had my eye on a few things. They have golden milk (a Turmeric based latte), matcha, and chai! My trio favs. As well as all the normal coffee and latte options. I tried a latte. Plain jane one (not the name) I just didn't do anything fancy to it. You can opt in oat milk, if that is your thing they have it! My latte was $4.35, oat milk was $0.75 but I didn't do that. It was good, not amazing...prices do seem a tad high. Their food looks yummy, I will def come back to try some soon and try one of my trio favs.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is their only parking lot, in the back. It has these 5 spots plus 1 handicap and 1 other reg spot. Total of 7 spots!
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gift cards

_LH37eFWGfYtFwb9EfCtPA.text: Undercurrent is a wonderful coffee shop in the plaza midwood area. Lots of comfy seating inside and patio area outside. They have Oat milk as a dairy free option. Their lattes are fantastic. I usually order the brown sugar vanilla oat milk latte. It's very good. They have baked goods as well as quiche, avocado toast, yogurt bowls. Nice spot to sit and have a cup of coffee if you're in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oat milk vanilla latte

8CnBj--4eGbaqvtJwlOBNg.text: Undercurrent Coffee NAILS everything! From all the obvious things you'd want to the smallest details you didn't even know would add to your coffee shop experience, I was truly impressed. Visiting from Southern California, we're not lacking in coffee shops and as a student I've visited a ton over the last few years, but Undercurrent has distanced itself as my best coffee shop experience to date!  COFFEE / FOOD Delicious! Not only is their drip fresh and their lattes beautifully crafted, they offer a relatively large menu of options including non-caffeinated drinks and speciality drinks. Their coffee is a smooth, balanced experience and you really can't go wrong with their offerings. You can really appreciate their creativity in some of their drink. As for the food, while it might not blow you away, they have a number of brunch options including a grits bowl that isn't too bad.  SERVICE Every worker I've come across so far has been pleasant and helpful. I've had no issues and even when there was a power outage for a time, the workers were very accommodating to allow customers to still hangout inside while other nearby business closed down completely.  AMBIENCE / AMENITIES This is probably where Undercurrent shines the most! Inside, you'll find a spacious, clean, and modern shop accentuated by large windows and tungsten lighting that invite a remarkably warm atmosphere. I love the minimalistic feel of the whole place.  As for amenities, they offer a number of seating options from couches towards the front, a community work table in the middle, and small tables towards the back. Bar seating throughout. At each spot, you'll find conveniently placed outlets. Seating is comfortable and the desks are wooden in texture (I hate glossy/glass tables). Parking can be limited but there are no time limits on the main street!  Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend Undercurrent Coffee! Really wish we had this place in SoCal--it would be my absolute go-to for meetups, studying, or just to relax. Go check them out!

NFogFYRoOcwqdlm5NOPcsg.text: Definitely a cute coffee shop off of commonwealth. I've heard parking can be a difficulty (although I haven't experienced it). Big windows provide for natural light. It is not overly nosey so you could get work down and have a small meeting. Seating may be a little scarce so prepare if you planning on staying there to enjoy your beverage. I drank tea, and they had a pretty good selection of flowerful options.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

L8zKK_gfYfCLR0mNDTC1qA.text: Undercurrent rapidly became a Plaza staple and for that I truly commend them!  This place has such a distinct vibe--they really put a lot of thought into it. The shop itself is very cute. There's a ton of natural light and a mix of table and lounge chairs. Space is definitely limited and you will be pressed to find a seat on the weekends. Wifi is good!  The coffee is DELICIOUS. Espresso specifically. I've had a latte, cortado, and cold brew, and it's all top-notch. I say this not really believing that Charlotte has great coffee--this is great coffee. It's rich, dark, fresh, and high-quality.   The food is decent. Portions are meh. I've had baked goods, chia pudding, and avo toast (and a bite of the turmeric yogurt). The vegan carrot cake muffin is far too ginger-y and is just a little too weird. The chia pudding was fine but I can make that myself. The avo toast was super loaded and yummy. My mom loved the golden yogurt.  My only qualm with this place is the pricepoint--it's up there. For an occasional treat, it's worth it, but it'd be more successful if everything was $1-2 less.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado toast with extra egg
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Latte and messy mocha (their dairy-free whipped cream RICK&#39;S)
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

CrpwDGqMtE0aEEr8rwR4PQ.text: Chic. Mixed use space. Warm. Quaint.  Undercurrent has been booming since the day it opened. It have a European vibe, feeling slightly Mediterranean or Grecian. The coffee menu is good - offering oat milk and all the other non-dairy options. They have tasty treat selections and even a small menu of kitchen made items. Sometimes I pop in for a Togo cup and when I have ample time I squeeze into a shared table to do a little work or chat with a friend for an hour.  The space is small, but welcoming. It feels like you want to be there. On this day i had golden oat milk latte and the avacado toast.   Oh, the owner is Super nice a steward of the community who knows his coffee well!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

7FENjsDwSj-xt0yfC0lzqA.text: The toast was delicious with great flavor profiles. Lattes were we'll balanced as well. The blueberry chia pudding looked good too. Definitely would be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lavendar latte, matcha latte, avocado toast, strawberry and goat cheese toast

cCK2wKHUUM8kTlR4PMQAmA.text: One of my favorite coffee shops because of the inventive drinks and great breakfasts and snacks! This cute place is tucked in Elizabeth. There's plenty of seats inside to get comfy and a lot of windows for an airy, open feel.   I love their seasonal specialty drinks. They play with both cold and hot coffee/espresso drinks and just know the right flavors to pair with their beans and brew method. My favorite winter drink is the campfire cupacino -- it's a smoked black tea with marshmallow that literally tastes like a campfire smells.   Their breakfast and snack foods are delicious! The muffins are vegan and they'll warm them up for you. The avocado toast is over the top in the best way possible -- and you can add a poached egg, which I recommend. The oats are delicious as well. You really can't go wrong!   Seating outside and parking outback is pretty limited. You can find street parking, however.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Campfire cupateano
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avo toast and campfire cupateano

2jiSc632BPqaJmdcSYNklg.text: It's in the fine tuning and the details.  This little shop is quite refined and well curated all the way around.  Every detail was precisely planned in a way that fuses the perfect low-key Midwood coffeehouse environment.  From the colors to the cups and the decor to the floor; it all gives a sense of calm and class.  What makes it even better is that just as much thought and care is put into every cup of coffee brewed as well.  Located in the middle of the infamous Commonwealth curve, across from The Common Market, you must be prepared for the reverse angled parking along the street, but there's also a very small lot around the backside of the building.  However, it's primarily a walking destination for the Midwood minglers, so it's never much an issue.  Once inside, you're greeted by the tasteful designs that give that welcoming allure.    Step to the counter to place your order.  A small selection of baked goods rest in the case to the left and a menu board is posted to the right.  The menu boasts simplicity, as the focus is on quality vs. quantity of offerings.  It's not the place for your triple pump, 1/2 soy, white chocolate, pumpkin, machimattato basic chick BS.  If that's what you're after, there's a Starbucks in the Harris Teeter on the corner, so please step aside.   A coffee connoisseur's dream.  Undercurrent awaits you...  Check out the studio in the back by the restrooms to learn more about cuppings and classes offered.

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Espresso machine at the bar.
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. #green #environmentfriendly 100% compostable to go cups made from corn.
Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Iced vanilla latte to go.

UVpvGjczkFiLRVrEfR5DJg.text: Excellent Iced Latte!  First time I visited & had a great experience, coffee was done to perfection, I'm a super coffee addict and this coffee shop is definitely on my list of tops! Was recommended from a friend in Miami! & I am highly recommending it to you guys! It's a must! If you've never been. Great vibes inside and outside!

photos.caption: Photo of Undercurrent Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
